isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 7: VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - INSTALLATION - MAIN BEARING AND CAP

step1.para: With acceptable bearing clearance, proceed as follows:

step2.para: Clean Plastigage(r) from main bearing or crankshaft journal surface.
Coat all bearing surface journals and bolts with clean engine oil.
Place No. 1 through No. 6 main bearing caps with lower bearing inserts installed.

note.para: BE SURE the main bearings are installed with the arrow pointing to the camside and numbered from the front of the engine to the rear.

step2.para:
Install the main bearing caps and tighten No.1 through No. 6 main bearing cap bolts to the special torque value. Refer to Figure 7.83
.
Install rear thrust bearing as follows:
Insert main bearing cap with rear thrust bearing into position.
Center rear thrust bearing by moving crankshaft rearward, then forward.
Tighten two (2) rear thrust bearing bolts finger-tight, then tighten to the special torque value.

Check crankshaft end play using a dial indicator as follows: Refer to Figure 7.84
.
Mount the dial indicator on crankcase with indicator tip on crankcase flange face.
Lightly pry the crankshaft forward and zero indicator.
Then pry crankshaft rearward and record dial indicator reading. Repeat to assure an accurate reading.

note.para: If end play exceeds specifications, replace thrust bearing and recheck crankshaft end play. If end play is less than specified, loosen main bearing caps, reposition, torque and recheck end play.

step1.para: Install piston and connecting rod assemblies. Refer to Section 6.
Install front cover. Refer to Section 8.
Install oil pump assembly. Refer to Section 9.
